result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric William Eisel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must continue with treatment with Psychiatric Services or other provider to address depression. No contact with victim, Phillips 66 gas stations, or S & F Food Mart. Must be compliant with any and all child support orders. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless one has already been provided and defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes:
**AMENDED 7-29-2016:  Conditional time is 90 days.**
Huber is granted for employment and treatment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: MODIFIED 9/23/15 TO INCLUDE: DEFENDANT MAY BE ALLOWED TO ATTEND COUNSELING SESSIONS WHILE ON GPS MONITORING***  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with victim store, Phillips 66 in Sturtevant WI, except for restitution purposes.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 10-07-2015; DEFENDANT IS ALLOWED OUT OF THE HOUSE TO PARTICIPATE IN VISITATION SUPERVISED BY THE HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT.

AMENDED 02-01-2016: DEFENDANT MAY SEEK AND MAINTAIN EMPLOYMENT

AMENDED 02-22-2016-GPS MAY BE REMOVED
